body_html:
Perhaps I'm misunderstanding, but could you use std::copy_n on Tensor::flat? For example, see FillValues in tensor_testutil.h.

That will avoid the element-by-element copy, but perhaps you were looking for ways to avoid a copy altogether?
body_text:
Perhaps I'm misunderstanding, but could you use std::copy_n on Tensor::flat? For example, see FillValues in tensor_testutil.h.
That will avoid the element-by-element copy, but perhaps you were looking for ways to avoid a copy altogether?
body:
Perhaps I'm misunderstanding, but could you use `std::copy_n` on `Tensor::flat`? For example, see [`FillValues` in `tensor_testutil.h`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/dcc414587f50673271a31ab767909ec89c956324/tensorflow/core/framework/tensor_testutil.h#L57).

That will avoid the element-by-element copy, but perhaps you were looking for ways to avoid a copy altogether?
